patterns.name: VCT - Victory by Continuous Threats
patterns.description: A forced winning sequence where each move creates a threat that must be answered. The opponent has no time to create their own threats.
patterns.example: Black creates multiple 3-in-a-row threats simultaneously. White must block one, but then Black creates another threat, and another, until Black wins.
patterns.keyTechnique: Create double threats (two 3-in-a-rows) - opponent can only block one!

patterns.name: Double Three Opening
patterns.description: One of the most powerful opening patterns. Black creates two potential 3-in-a-rows on the first few moves.
patterns.keyTechnique: Forces white into defensive position immediately. Very aggressive!

patterns.name: The Sword Formation
patterns.description: A diagonal formation that threatens in multiple directions. Named for its sword-like shape.
patterns.keyTechnique: Build diagonally while threatening horizontal and vertical connections.

patterns.name: VCF - Victory by Continuous Fours
patterns.description: Even stronger than VCT! Each move creates a four-in-a-row that MUST be blocked. Leads to forced checkmate.
patterns.keyTechnique: Once you have VCF, opponent can't escape. Like a mating attack in chess!
